author: GlobePRwire
title: Houston to Host Spectacular Womens History Month Celebration Featuring Victory Brinker, Montoia Murray, Dr. Tiana Von Johnson | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
Houston, TX - Women's History Month in Houston is set to be an extraordinary affair, as the city prepares to host a celebration like no other. On March 24, 2024, at a Private Location. Houstonians will gather to honor and celebrate phenomenal women from all walks of life.Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee will receive the Living Legends Award.
Headlining the event is the sensational Victory Brinker, whose remarkable vocal talent has captured the hearts of audiences worldwide. At just 12, Victory has already made history as the youngest opera singer in the Guiness Book of World Records and her mesmerizing voice promises to enchant and inspire all in attendance.
Joining Victory Brinker on stage will be Montoia Murray, the MLK Oratory Winner, whose eloquent words and powerful message have earned her acclaim and admiration. Montoia's impassioned speeches have ignited change and hope in communities across the nation, making her a fitting addition to the lineup of speakers at this prestigious event.
Dr. Tiana Von Johnson, renowned entrepreneur and motivational speaker, will also take the stage to share her insights on "Unlocking Your Millionaire Mind and Branding Your Brilliance." Dr. Johnson's expertise in business and branding has empowered countless individuals to achieve success and realize their full was potential.
Hosting the annual celebration will be none other than Dr. Sonia White, a USAF Veteran and Chief Editor/Founder of the WOW Magazine. Dr. White's dedication to honoring and uplifting women has made her a respected figure in the community, and her leadership ensures that this event will be nothing short of spectacular.
Keynote speaker Dr. Jacqueline Mohair will deliver a powerful address. Master of Ceremony State Rep. Ron Reynolds and Emcee/Honoree, Dr Twiler Portis will guide guests through an evening of celebration and inspiration. Special guest speakers include Dr. Niâ€™Cola Mitchell Founder of â€œGirls Who Brunch Tourâ€is a Best-Selling author who made the Forbes List as a Change Maker. Dr. Niâ€™Cola was featured with her own Lifetime movie, â€œGiving Hope: The Niâ€™Cola Mitchell Storyâ€. This will be a spectacular and historical event celebrating Womenâ€™s History Month. Winners of the World Global Magazine is set to inspire and share stories of incredible men and women. Subscribe and support winnersoftheworld.com @wowglobalmag IG and Facebook.
"We are thrilled to bring together such a talented and diverse lineup of speakers and performers for this year's Women's History Month Celebration," said Dr. Sonia White. "This event is an opportunity to honor the achievements and contributions of women throughout history, and to inspire future generations to dream big and achieve their goals."
The Women's History
Email wowglobalmag@gmail.com
Media Email soniawhite649@gmail.com
Contact person name Dr. Sonia R. White
Company name Winners of the World Global Magazine
Website URL: http://winnersoftheworld.com

author: Matthew Evans
title: Pilot praised for averting New Year easyJet plane crash | News Shopper
text:
A pilot has been praised for their quick thinking after an easyJet flight almost collided with another plane in an air traffic control error.
The controller is believed to have "forgotten" about another plane waiting to take off before allowing an Airbus A320 with 179 people on board, from Gatwick Airport to Bordeaux-Merignac, to come into land.
And the incident on New Year's Eve last year has now been classified as a "serious encounter" by a French investigative body.
The organisation has pointed the finger at air traffic control for forgetting about the other plane, a Robin DR400 awaiting take-off, and giving the green light for the A320 to touch down.
âœˆï¸ Need quick assistance with a personal touch?
ðŸ‘‰ Introducing our Live Chat & WhatsApp services.
Our friendly team is ready to answer your questions ðŸ‘‹
ðŸ—¨ï¸ Simply message us here for Live Chat âž¡ï¸ https://t.co/meUAZqJyYB
ðŸ“± Or here for WhatsApp âž¡ï¸ https://t.co/JOHo7CIX1p
â€” easyJet (@easyJet) September 20, 2023 Pilots of easyJet flight were 'not aware of the other aircraft'
France's Bureau of Enquiry and Analysis for Civil Aviation Safety said on the day of the incident that "the shift manager... had reduced the number of controllers to three" down from six, in a new report.
It stated: "FR traffic then became very dense. The controller ... late authorised the A320 to land, forgetting the presence of the DR400 at the threshold.
"The DR400 pilot, having understood that the A320 was authorized to land while still at threshold 23, reported to the controller, who immediately ordered the A320 to abort the approach."
It explained how the pilots on the easyJet flight were never aware of the other aircraft.
An easyJet spokesperson told the Daily Star: "We are aware of the report regarding the ATC error which confirms that our pilots followed procedures at all times. The safety of our passengers and crew is our highest priority and we will always co-operate with safety investigations."
. @easyJet get a lot of criticism, but Iâ€™ve just seen the most beautiful love & care shown to a passenger on my flight with severe anxiety & panic attacks. The pilot even came to see him to reassure him before take off. People can be lovely ðŸ’œ
â€” Anna Yearley Carreira (@AnnaYearley) December 28, 2023 The report continued: "The tower manager and the controller, surprised, then became aware of the situation. The A320 crew, mainly focused on the endpoint during the final approach, never identified the presence of an aircraft at the runway threshold.
"The missed approach was nominally executed by the easyJet crew. The lowest point of the trajectory was located at a height of 103 ft, at a distance of approximately 290 m from the runway threshold. The A320 flew over the DR400 at a height of 178 ft, then continued on the standard trajectory."
Thankfully a disaster was averted and the DR400 later got the all-clear for take-off with the Airbus making a smooth landing on its second attempt.
The DR400 pilot has also been credited for their quick thinking.
EasyJet Transport

title: Banda Aviva Group gana como Artista RevelaciÃ³n en Premios El GalardÃ³n - Diario Libre
text:
La emergente banda cristiana Aviva Group resultÃ³ ganadora en la categorÃ­a Artista RevelaciÃ³n del AÃ±o Central , otorgada por los Premios El GalardÃ³n .
"Haber ganado el premio nos llenÃ³ de gran gozo, pues con tan solo 9 meses de haber sido lanzado el grupo , demuestra que los sueÃ±os se pueden cumplir", externÃ³ Wander GuzmÃ¡n , lÃ­der de la banda.
El mÃºsico Abner BidÃ³ explicÃ³ que pertenecer a la agrupaciÃ³n tiene un significado especial.
"Nosotros sentimos que fue un regalo que Dios nos entregÃ³, ya que nos gozamos grandemente; disfrutamos el hecho de poder llevar la palabra de Dios a travÃ©s de la mÃºsica y las alabanzas", afirmÃ³ el artista.
De igual manera, Ãlex Herrera y Anahel Abreu , tambiÃ©n vocalistas de Aviva Group , entienden que el Ã©xito principal de la agrupaciÃ³n , es que tienen a Cristo como el centro de su ministerio".
"El aÃ±o pasado tuvimos el placer de ir a Cartagena , Colombia , de manera mÃ¡s especÃ­fica a la comunidad de Pasa Caballo, siendo esta una experiencia increÃ­ble, donde pudimos ministrar y ser ministrados", explicaron como ejemplo de la presencia de Cristo en sus vidas, detalla una nota de prensa.
Ronny RamÃ­rez , otro de los vocalistas, informÃ³ que tambiÃ©n han realizado trabajo evangelÃ­stico en las calles, barrios, lugares de personas desamparadas y otras con problemas de adicciÃ³n.
"Nuestro mensaje para los nuevos y jÃ³venes artistas, es que lo primordial es seguir a Cristo y que no se limiten crear gÃ©neros nuevos", externÃ³ RamÃ­rez.
Todos los integrantes hacen un llamado a la unidad de las iglesias en general.
"Que seamos uno, como el Padre es uno con JesÃºs y el EspÃ­ritu Santo. Que nos apoyemos unos con otros sin importar cuÃ¡l gÃ©nero musical interpretemos".
MÃ¡s sobre Aviva Group El ministerio Aviva Group nace de la revelaciÃ³n de parte de Dios, que tuvo el pastor MÃ©rido Guzman .
Realizaron su lanzamiento el 19 de junio de 2023, en la iglesia TabernÃ¡culo de AdoraciÃ³n , que lidera el pastor Santiago Ponciano.
La mayor parte de sus integrantes provienen de la Zona Oriental , teniendo al distrito nacional como su base de operaciones.
" Manos Santas " es el mÃ¡s reciente sencillo lanzado por la agrupaciÃ³n , propuesta musical que tiene como mensaje central que el SeÃ±or avive el fuego en nuestros corazones y que traiga ese primer amor a nuestras vidas.
El videoclip fue lanzado el pasado 24 de marzo en la popular plataforma de Youtube y tambiÃ©n estÃ¡ en todas las plataformas digitales.
Fue producido por Mis Perlas Films , con un concepto de video live, donde ponen de manifiesto un rendimiento ante los pies de Cristo , reconociendo cuÃ¡ndo se han apartado del camino y necesitan volver al primer amor.
La canciÃ³n fue compuesta y producida por el joven y talentoso productor y arreglista Israel Amarante .
GÃ©neros como el Worship , Gospel, AdoraciÃ³n y ritmos tropicales, forman parte del versÃ¡til repertorio de Aviva Group , que es caracterizado por un mensaje cristocÃ©ntrico, de salvaciÃ³n y evangelÃ­stico.
Otros temas lanzados son: " AvÃ­vanos ", "Profetiza" y "Es Ahora", que cuenta con mÃ¡s de 1.5 millones de vistas en Youtube . TambiÃ©n el merengue " Cristo te Ama", al cual le han llamado MerenWorship.

author: , Canton Repository
title: Off-duty Jackson Local bus driver saves family's dogs from burning home
text:
Off-duty Jackson Local bus driver saves family's dogs from burning home
JACKSON TWP. â€“ Todd Morris was enjoying his unexpected day off, running errands and visiting his favorite doughnut shop Dough Co. for a sweet treat before heading back to his township home late Wednesday morning.
He spotted smoke as he drove along Traphagen Street NW.
"It wasn't chimney smoke," Morris said.
He realized it was coming from behind Jackson Fire Station No. 2, so he turned down the roadway and pulled up to a home at 3826 Amherst Ave. NW. Smoke and flames were shooting from the windows.
Morris is familiar with the home and the family living there. As a Jackson Local Schools bus driver, he picks up two children from the house every day. Frigid temperatures had closed school that day so he worried if "his kids" were inside the burning residence.
Muscle memory kicked in and he charged toward the door.
The retired Jackson Township police officer immediately dialed the fire station's telephone number â€” something he had learned during safety lessons in kindergarten decades earlier â€” and reported the fire.
Jackson Local bus driver rescues dogs from house fire
He said he banged on the door and got no response. Morris knew he had to do more. He went into the bi-level home - something he had done before on the job - and called out the children's names.
"I was doing a search to find my kids," the 1989 Jackson High School graduate said. "I call them my kids because they are from my bus."
Morris searched downstairs and the upstairs, coming close to flames in the living area. Several times he left to get fresh air before continuing his search.
Eventually, he came across the family's two dogs.
"They were sitting at the bottom of the steps with a deer in the headlight look," Morris said. He helped the pets, carrying one of them, to safety. He took them to his truck, where they were warm and happy enjoying the doughnuts Morris had bought earlier that day.
Once emergency personnel began to arrive, Morris called his wife and told her to bring leashes for the dogs.
"We're a big rescue family," he added. Morris then phoned the district's transportation secretary to get contact information for the family.
Morris spoke with the mother, explaining the situation and that he was caring for the family's dogs.
He took the dogs - a mastiff mix and shepherd mix - home and cleaned them up. Morris learned one of the dogs had neuropathy and has difficulty walking.
Knowing that the family's world had been turned upside down, Morris wanted to ease their minds a bit. On Wednesday night, the family picked up their pets. Morris made sure to give them toys, bowls and dog food. The family's pet cat was still missing after the fire.
The Army veteran says he was at the right place at the right time. He is hopeful any other neighbor would have done the same thing.
"I want to think I've done what every other person would have done when you see a family in need," Morris said. "It's a Jackson neighbor helping a Jackson neighbor."
Cause of Jackson house fire unclear
As of Thursday, the cause of the fire remained under investigation.
Several 9-1-1 calls were received regarding the fire around 11:30 a.m. Wednesday. Callers reported flames could be seen coming from the windows of the home.
The home was fully involved when firefighters from Jackson Township, Massillon, Green and Canal Fulton arrived.
The family of five was not home at the time the blaze broke out. The parents were at work and the four children were at their grandmother's home, officials said.
The three-bedroom bi-level home, built in 1952, sustained heavy damage its interior, roof and walls.
A GoFundMe account has been created to aid the family and has collected more than $16,500 for the family as of Thursday afternoon. A goal of $22,000 has been set.
Todd Porter, communication director of Jcakson Local, said the district's family support team and counselors have been in contact with the family. Donations of gift cards for the family can be dropped off at Amherst Elementary School or Jackosn Memorial Middle School.
Reach Amy at 330-775-1135 or amy.knapp@indeonline.com.
